intro: Ayapana turbacensis, commonly known as the Turbacio Ayapana, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible fruits. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Ayapana turbacensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and streamside areas.
